title: Sinaloid
region: NW & North-Central Mexico (Sinaloa, Sonora, Durango, Chihuahua, Coahuila, Nuevo León)
notes: Formed in the ranching/mining belt through Spanish–Indigenous admixture. Light–medium brown skin (tans deeply); male faces often rounder, females slightly longer; medium projecting nose; full lips; dark eyes with lighter shades in a minority; slight epicanthic folds can appear; hair dark brown–black (straight/wavy, curls not rare); average height, stockier build. Est. ancestry: 43–56% European, 40–50% Indigenous American, 2–6% African.
